name: Black Lion Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a night on the way home from a week in Suffolk. We saw a big improvement on our stay back in 2009.
reviews.title: Room 2 -very comfortable big bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Evening meal & breakfast excellent with attentive service.
reviews.title: Quirky, but highly enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New owner working hard to upgrade the hotel.
reviews.title: An evening meal at the Black Lion Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big bed in room 2, quirky but updated bathroom, clean & warm.
reviews.title: Gadzooks!

reviews.text: Parking is a village problem, I was lucky to get a space.
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed with my wife at the Black Lion Hotel in Walsingham. The Lady Hotelier was incredibly accommodating and friendly.
reviews.title: Warm, Friendly, Great Value Historic Hotel with an Amazing Bed!

reviews.text: The room was spotlessly clean and full of beams and character (unsurprisngly given the buildings age) and the super king size bed was absolutely fantastic. I travel regularly with my work and it is possibly the best sleep I have ever had away from home- getting down to Breakfast was a struggle for us both!
reviews.title: Wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't try the full English breakfast but I ordered poached eggs on toast which were perfectly done and served quickly. There was ample toast, cereals and juices of all the usual varieties. The dining room had a nice breakfast ambience with background jazz music set against beams and wide open fireplaces.
reviews.title: Well Worth A Visit...................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We both really enjoyed the all day tapas - being able to order something one doesn't expect in this part of the world ( we ordered food at 10:40 pm!) -the chunky chips and honey glazed local sausages were tasty and well priced. The free wi-fi was also a bonus but the coverage was not brilliant in every single area of the hotel which is understandable given its design and age- but it's certainly beats paying a ridiculous price or having to sit in reception to send and e-mail! Perhaps the only downside is that parking outside the hotel is limited (due to the historic chocolate box location- see Google Earth) but there is an ample pay and display less than 2 minutes walk away - strictly speaking this is not fault of the hotel,
reviews.title: This hotel is lovely and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a pretentious place, it is a historic pub hotel which having seems to have been turned around by a dedicated hotelier who works very hard.
reviews.title: Would not book again!

reviews.text: Visited the restaurant (didn't stay there) for Dad's 80th birthday as we'd seen it online & it sounded great. Admittedly we did have to change the booking due to car trouble & they kindly accomodated that. But it was a Tuesday night - the only diners were our party of seven & two couples. They had run out of so many things. Only enough duck for two starters or one main course. Not even any rice, so my sister had to have her stroganoff with chips! My seasonal vegetables with steak & ale pie were just two big lumps of broccoli! We asked what the steak garnish was & explained that my mum is allergic to mushrooms, so not to put that on. It came out with mushrooms on top, the new steak came out almost raw & had to go back to the kitchen.
reviews.title: They had run out of so much!
Disgusted! Double check your booking before you turn up!
reviews.text: My dad asked for his brace of eggs to be well done - he got one runny egg & had to send that back too, so we were all eating at different times. The waiter was absolutely great & wrote down everything we said, so it must have been the kitchen staff that were at fault. It was a shame as it was a special occasion. I waited a long time to speak to the manageress who was busy serving beers to the people in the bar watching the Olympics on TV. There was no-one else to speak to. I was given a free bottle of wine as compensation. It is a lovely old building, but a disappointing experience for us, especially at those prices. We had much better meals for the same price or less locally.

Booked two double rooms and when we arrived they had only allocated one room! No management around and the staff were all 'new' so nobody had a clue what to do as all other rooms were full. I was told I would hear from the manager later that night when she returned. Surprise, surprise, still waiting.....
reviews.title: The restaurant scores

reviews.text: Expecting catered food, I was delighted to discover a chef who took a pride in locally sourced ingredients and who was happy to tailor a meal to our needs. On consecutive nights the meals were first class (lamb shank one night, cod loin the other), and even though it was not on the breakfast menu, he happily responded to a request the night before for eggs benedict.
reviews.title: Very poor experience

reviews.text: The hotel has a happily lived-in look and a chatty staff. The constraints of an historic building make for compromises in layout, for example the small bathrooms others have mentioned. That did not detract too much. One unexpected disadvantage was the cheap quality mattresses on decent bedframes. Whether it was the wrong mattresses for the bedframes or the bedframe screws coming loose, every turn in the beds made a great noise (room 5). This needs to be addressed. Overall, though, a good stay.
reviews.title: Loved it :-)

reviews.text: Three of us stopped for dinner on Sunday night. Delicious fresh sea bass & lamb shanks - all beautifully presented & reasonably priced. Food worthy of a good restaurant & a great selection of real ales. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: superb food

reviews.text: My sister and I had a wonderful tapas meal on Saturday ... walked the Holy Mile and ended up there as a fantastic end to a lovely walk ... Food magnificent, we had seconds as it was so good. Recommend it to any weary pilgrim. The staff were so friendly, and we could have stayed there much longer, if it wasn't for a 4 hour coach trip home ... Thank you to the lovely lady who served us, and for meeting Billie, Poppy and the invisible Amber ... we will definitely be back. Thank you from Jane and Amanda, you made our day
reviews.title: Tapas on a wet pilgrimage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staying at a hoilday home in great walsingham.last year we stayed at the black lion and didnt think much of it but it was just reopened .we decided to pop in the other night for a drink and may be a meal .no one was around to serve us .when the landlady did appear she was so rude we just left.and went to the bull who i must say are great well done to them on 1st class food the staff are lovely .we will never set foot in the black lion while this horried rude lady is running it . i will be writing to enterprize who i belive owns it
reviews.title: will not be going back

reviews.text: we have stayed at the black lion for ten years and yes it has improved,the restaurant has a good choice of food,which was very tasty when it eventually arrived.We told Irene that as our friends were staying as well(on our recommendation),we would all eat together,we were all shocked to discover there was a ten per cent charge for having more than six at a table!!!!!!
reviews.title: beware eating with friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish I could split my reviews here: I would give the hotel four stars and the restaurant five.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Food.

description: A 700 year old coaching inn with seven en-suite bedrooms, several with original medieval feature walls and windows. The restaurant serves modern British cuisine and is based on what local seasonal ingredients are available from the farmers and fishermen. There is all day tapas and light snacks and during the winter they serve a sit in or takeaway "soup kitchen" menu. A la carte is available lunch and dinner. The bar serves several local cask ales and ciders, the usual selection of lagers, spirits and wines and has a good top shelf of Scotch and Whiskey.
